      class  AuthenticationClearTextPassword 
      class  AuthenticationMD5Password 
      class  AuthenticationOk
      The Authentication is succeeded
      class  BackendKeyData
      This message provides secret-key data that the frontend must save if it wants to be able to issue cancel requests later.

      class  CloseComplete 
      class  CommandComplete 
      class  DataRow 
      class  EmptyQueryResponse
      Identifies the message as a response to an empty query string.

      class  NoData 
      class  NoticeResponse 
      class  NotificationResponse 
      class  ParameterDescription 
      class  ParameterStatus
      This message informs the frontend about the current (initial) setting of backend parameters.
      class  ParseComplete 
      class  PortalSuspended
      The appearance of this message tells the frontend that another Execute should be issued against the same portal to complete the operation.
      class  ReadyForQuery
      The frontend can issue commands.
      class  Response
      A common response message for PostgreSQL Error and Notice Message Fields

    • Uses of Message in com.julienviet.pgclient.codec.encoder.message

      Classes in com.julienviet.pgclient.codec.encoder.message that implement Message 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Bind
      The message gives the name of the prepared statement, the name of portal, and the values to use for any parameter values present in the prepared statement.
      class  Close
      The message closes an existing prepared statement or portal and releases resources.
      class  Describe
      The message that using "statement" variant specifies the name of an existing prepared statement.
      class  Execute
      The message specifies the portal and a maximum row count (zero meaning "fetch all rows") of the result.
      class  Parse
      The message contains a textual SQL query string.
      class  PasswordMessage 
      class  Query
      This message includes an SQL command (or commands) expressed as a text string.
      class  StartupMessage 
      class  Sync
      The purpose of this message is to provide a resynchronization point for error recovery.
      class  Terminate
      This message immediately closes the connection.
